[1]Oh, God, no! The hair's wrong. This is a bad sign. We really need to get a make-up person?!

[5]For three decades the Kowolski Family Bakery has been a mainstay in downtown Buffalo. Known for their sinfully rich, cream filled, deep fried polski pierogis. And the occasional sugar induced coma that follows. Today, in honor of their 30 year anniversary, Momma Kowolski and her sons Gustov and Vol, decided to do something, a little bit different. Tell me guys, how did this idea come about? 
[6]Wow. Fascinating. 
[7]The previous Buffalo cookie record was 3 feet, 17 inches baked by Gladys Pelsnick. But this behemoth cookie clearly proving that Gustov and Vol have much more free time. 
[8]As we witness the ceremonial toasting with milk it makes one pause and think. What are we really looking at here? 
[9]Is it just a big cookie or does this cookie represent the pride of Buffalo? Our dedicated and hard working citizens the key ingredient, with a few nuts thrown in. And finally, the love of our families which provides the warm chewy center making our beloved Buffalo the sweetest place to live. 
[10]And that's the way the cookie crumbles. I'm Bruce Nolan, Eyewitness News. 
[11]So, what do you think?

[193]Since the disapearence of Teamster president Jimmy Hoffa in the nineteen sixties, his whereabouts have remained one of this country's great unsolved mysteries. That is until just moments ago, when during a routine training session, a police dog named Hank sniffed his way right into the history books. As you can see behind us, the body is being carefully exhumed and will be transported to a hospital facility where DNA testing will confirm the identity. That, of course, only a formality as in a bizarre twist, the body was found buried with a birth certificate and complete set of dental records. I 'm go in g t o go home and if by some miracle it                          * suddenly becomes a 'good time', you                        * know where to find me.                                     * And speaking of time, you're                               * running out of it.                                         * 
[96]Okay, this is getting ridiculous I 
[97]I have to see a doctor. There's definitely something wrong with me. 
[98]I look like a hooker I My whole body is changing. 
[99]My back didn't used to arch like this. 
[100]Bruce, I feel like our relationship is becoming all about sex. 
[101]No, Bruce. Come on.                                   * 
[102]No, I'm not. 
[103]Oh my goshI How did I sleep this late? I've got to run. Are you giving me a ride? 
[104]y ou' re c ra zy . Ca n we a ff ord t ha t? 
[105]L ook! I'm back to no rmal. It was the wildest thing, I was worried, so I said a prayer and the next thing I know, I was completely healed. It was like a miracle. 
[106]So, you're taking me to lunch? Th is i s ra re -- But wonderful. 
[107]Oh, you'll never believe it. Debbie won the lotteryI 
[108]But get this, there were like 433 thousand other winners, so it only paid out 17 dollars. Can you believe the odds of that? 
[109]What is this? 
[110]What? 
[111]This had to cost-- I can't even imagine how much this had to cost. 
[112]Wh-What am I missing here? You can't afford this. You're a reporter. Buying cars is one t hing, but this--

[117]
[118]

[124]I'm sorry, but    I won't be attending your little pa   rty tomorrow. And if                 * you would like    to see me after I will be at our   home.                                *

[127]I don't know. It's his big night.                      * I don't want to spoil it. I know                  .    * how much this means to him.                            *

[129]Here. I do n't w ant your car. I don't want your things. . . I don't want you.

[132]Yeah, a big boat and oh, maybe two bags of cash, you know, the ones with the big cartoon dollar signs on the front. Then I'll be happy. Because I'm just hollow inside. Debbie's been right. All this time. I defended you, told her there was good in you. Another side to you. Well, I just saw that other side and I don't want anything to do with it. 
[133]Go back to your little co-anchor. Or is that ho-anchor? I came back here to apologize. How stupid am I? 
[134]Hi.. 
[135]That's great. I hope it goes well for you. 
[136]. . . I don't know what to say. 
[137]No, Bruce.

dialogues.GOD:
[1]Three. 
[2]Two. 
[3]Four. Nine. Six. Eight. One... 
[4]Seven. 
[5]You've been doing a lot of complaining about me, Bruce. And quite frankly, I'm tired of it... 
[6]Well, that's not very neighborly. I brought you here to offer you a job. 
[7]My job. You think you can do it better, so here's your chance. When you leave this building you will be endowed with all my powers. 
[8]All the power of God. 
[9]Havin' fun? 
[10]Let's take a walk. 
[11]Most people want to kill these guys. I'm quite fond of em'. Very streamlined design. Like little armored tanks. Y'know, they can hold their breath for forty minutes and their cells divide only once per molting cycle creating a cytoskeleton with cell adhesion that... Oh, this is a bit over your head, isn't it? 
[12]Okay, let me explain the rules. 
[13]Yeah, you left in such a rush I didn't get a chance to explain. 
[14]I figured that would get your attention.. I did the same thing to Ghandi, he couldn't eat for three weeks. Now, here's the deal. You have all my power. Use it any way you choose. There are only two rules. You can't tell anyone you're God. Believe me you don't want that kind of attention. And you can't mess with free will. 
[15]Yes you can. That's the beauty it. 
[16]Oh, speaking of amazing... 
[17]Since you're finished with these, I think I'll hang to 'em. Might come in handy someday. 
[18]I'll be seein' ya. 
[19]I'm taking a vacation. 
[20]Ever hear of the Dark Ages? Besides, I'm covered. You can fix everything in five minutes if you want to, right? 
[21]Really something isn't it? 
[22]It's Everest. You should try flipping on the Discovery Channel every now and then. Well, I guess you can't now, being dead and all. 
[23]No, I'm just messing with you. 
[24]They're prayers, Bruce. You keep ignoring them and they're going to build up on. you like that. You didn't think being God was going to be all fun and games did you? 
[25]You aren't listening, son. Let's see, you've had my powers for over a week now and how many people have you helped? 
[26]The world? That wasn't the world, Bruce. That was just Buffalo, between Commonwealth and 57th. Didn't want to start you out with more than you can handle. Now how you doing otherwise? Personal life in good shape? 
[27]Everything's great, huh? 
[28]Now it's heating up. 
[29]Nice recovery. 
[30]She's got a point. 
[31]You're going to have to answer those things, y'know. 
[32]You want some friendly advice? 
[33]You wanted the job, Bruce.     I                        * suggest you get to it.                                  * 
[34]Enjoying your party? Yeah, nothing like spending time with some real frien ds. Any s hrimp left ? 
[35]I know. 
[36]Would you take you back? 
[37]Welcome to my world, son. You come up with an answer to that one, you let me know.
dialogues.DEBBIE:
[1]Well, it seemed like they were speaking a foreign language sometimes, but no. Problemo? 
[2]Is it so wrong to tie them up? 
[3]You're good with them, you know. You should have some of your own. 
[4]Free milk cow. 
[5]If the moo fits. 
[6]Small Wonders Day Care. 
[7]No, it's Debbie. The sister who's life you're not wasting. 
[8]What? 
[9]Yeah, she should marry somebody famous, take the focus off. 
[10]We would have heard it ring. 
[11]He just needs to blow off some steam, he'll be fine. 
[12]Wow, you lashed? You never lash. I'm impressed. 
[13]Well, I've been praying to win the lottery for fifteen years, but it's not going to happen. You know, it's not all about money. 
[14]What?! 
[15]Zoe. 
[16]Hang on, I might need you to un- check a few things. 
[17]Hey, everybody back-off i 
[18]You're a saint, Grace. 
[19]So this is what success buys you. 
[20]Well, thank Mr. Exclusive for me. He's on a quite a roll. What'd he do make a deal with the devil? 
[21]Well, la-ti-da. Mike's idea of a romantic evening is Chez Sizzler. 
[22]What does this do again? 
[23]Grasa? Doesn't that mean fat? 
[24]Good - you wouldn't want to leave any spare oxygen in there. Wait a second, you don't think he's going to propose, do you? 
[25]You do. You think he's going to propose. 
[26]I don't know, hun. I mean, I like Bruce but that man's priority list is him, him, him, then him some more and then you. 
[27]That's what I'm worried about. Careful, you missed a spot of free flowing circulation. 
[28]That'd do it. 
[29]Let's see, how do I-- 
[30]Hey, I'll take that over fat... 
[31]So this is your new place, huh? 
[32]You sure you want to do this? 
[33]Oh, boy. 
[34]Right.
dialogues.JACK:
[1]Okay, promos are approved, let's-- 
[2]I would have swore I already said this, but promos are approved. Now                  * can we move on?                                     * 
[3]Evan, you'11 know something when I know something.

[5]Okay, knock it off... Bruce we're holding your story in reserve. Now, can we get back to the board so we have something to air today? 
[6]Sure, Bruce. What do you need? 
[7]You don't want to be like Evan. Evan's an asshole. 
[8]No, Bruce.     You can't. 
[9]Are you going to pick that up? 
[10]Look, Bruce. You're a good reporter. You make people laugh. God knows today we can use it. 
[11]Yep. 
[12]Well now you and Evan get the live feeds. 
[13]Yes, but watch yourself, Bruce. I've seen your outtakes. 
[14]What's going on?

dialogues.BOBBY:
[1]Bruce the goose! Morning, Buddy. Don't even move, I got somethin' special today. My mom made it just for you. 
[2]You like Quiche? 
[3]You know, contrary to popular belief the quiche was actually invented by the Mayans, then stolen by the French. They shoulda said, "Hey, that quiche ain't yours, it's Mayan!" 
[4]Just taste it, taste it... 
[5]That's a buck seventy-five. 
[6]Oh, two o'clock, two o'clock, two-o- five, two-ten... 
[7]Way out of our league, huh? 
[8]You know, I saw them editing your cookie piece. 
[9]They must have gotten high or something, cause they was orderin' everything, I had. Hey, how long have you been interested in pastry? 'Cause I've got an aunt who makes baklava twenty layers deep. 
[10]Maybe you could do a story on her! 
[11]I'll give her a call, we'll talk about it later! 
[12]Don't worry about it.    I called my aunt, we're on. 
[13]Hey, Br uce . N ice job , m an. Wa sn' t the same without you around here, pal. I hear Jack wants to see you. 
[14]You're going to need your energy in there. Can I interest you in a donut? 
[15]Coffee? 
[16]Fiber grain bar with bee pollen and Spiralina? 
[17]Yeah, I don't blame 'ya, they taste like grass. 
[18]Tell you    what? I wasn't going to break it    open until lunch time, but I made a    batch of rhubarb that you have got    to try. 
[19]Come on, it's my mother's recipe she's practically cripple... 
[20]Open up, that's it, here comes the news chopper... 
[21]Thanks. I've grown kind of attached to it.
dialogues.SUSAN:
[1]Bruce Nolan is standing by at Niagara Falls with a report on the Maid of the Mist sightseeing boat, but before we go live to Bruce, we have an announcement to make. As everyone knows, after 33 years, our beloved Pete Fineman is retiring. 
[2]Pete's shoes are virtually impossible to fill, but the show must go on. And we could think of no one better than our very own Evan Baxter. 
[3]Congratulations, Evan. Looks like we'll be sitting side by side from now on. 
[4]Wow. That was amazing. And now let's go live to wacky Bruce Nolan out at Niagara Falls. 
[5]We may be having a bit of technical difficulty... 
[6]Good evening and welcome to Eyewitness News at six. I'm Susan Ortega. 
[7]Looks like my new co-anchor may need a glass of water. 
[8]Somebody get some napkins.      Dallas, help me. 
[9]His hair's on fire! 
[10]Hi Br uce. What are you d oing out here all alone? 
[11]Yeah, I didn't see her in there. I love the new place, by the way. So how are you and Grace doing? 
[12]You're on fire Bruce. Some women can't handle fire. Some can. 
[13]You know, I always had an instinct about you. I knew you were going to make something of yourself. 
[14]There's something special about you Bruce. I like special... 
[15]I was right. She couldn't handle the fire. 
[16]Bruce, if I had any idea Grace was going to be there last night... 
[17]Oh, really. . . that's nice.
dialogues.JANITOR:
[1]Want me to even those up for you? 
[2]That'd be on the seventh floor. Stairs are right over there. 
[3]Out of order. 
[4]You mind giving me a hand with this floor? 
[5]. . . thinkin' they can hide from me. 
[6]Yeah, but I'll get around to it. 
[7]Nope.   Catchy jingle, though. 
[8]Okay, but the boss'11 be right out. 
[9]You must be Bruce. I've been expecting you. 
[10]Nothin' wrong with rollin' up your sleeves, son. People underestimate the benefits of good 'ol manual labor. There's freedom in it. Happiest people in the world stink like hell at the end of the day. 
[11]Your father knew that. He was a damn good welder. 
[12]Oh, I know a lot about you Bruce. Pretty much everything there is to know. Everything you've ever said, done or thought about doin', is right there in that file cabinet. 
[13]It's your life. 
[14]Now this last entry was a little disturbing. 
[15]Thanks for everything, Lord. 
[16]I am so honored that my horrible demise is a part of your loving and mysterious plan.. The gloves are off, pal.. Smite me oh mighty smiter. I'm not much for blaspheming but that one made me laugh. Oh, and let's not forget "What kind of a God would let this happen? I mean, have you seen then news lately?" 
[17]I'm the creator of the heavens and the earth. I'm the alpha & omega. The first and the last.
dialogues.EVAN:
[1]Is something killing your kids? Find out tonight at eleven. 
[2]No, just into watching. Or I could change it to: "Slow news day, come yawn with us. At eleven." 
[3]Yeah, yeah. Any word on the open anchor position, Jack? 
[4]And that's the way the cookie crumbles. 
[5]I'm just messin' with you, Bruce. See you've got to remember that the news room is like a cookie... 
[6]Thanks, Susan. I ' m thrilled and honored. Like you said, no one can replace the great Pete Fineman, but I'll do my best. I have to say I am so proud to be a part of our local community. Of Buffalo. I think a great city is a lot like a great recipe really. Put in some hard working citizens, add some care givers, maybe a few nuts... 
[7]All sprinkled with the strength and love of our good families, that ultimately creates a sweet place to live. Thank you. 
[8]And I'm Evan Baxter. And here's what's making news... 
[9]A potential scandal with the Buffalo P.D. surfaced today when... 
[10]...the mayor demanded that the Chief of Police issue... ...Uh-hum, that the Chief of Police...

[12]Ah, there we go. Sorry about that. The Prime Minister of Sweden visited Washington today as my little tiny nipples moved to France-

[14]Sorry, we're having a few technical difficulties, here... In other n-n-n-n....n-n-n-n...                     *
